item.title: Return Oriented Programming
item.description:
Return-Oriented Programming (ROP) – A Beginner’s Journey

So recently, I finally took the dive into Return-Oriented Programming (ROP) and wanted to document my experience. Not just for anyone else learning, but also for future me when I inevitably forget how I did this in a week.

This post is based on a simple binary exploitation flow, and I followed along with the John Hammond Misfortune CTF ROP video. Highly recommend checking that out if you’re just getting into this.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
👋 Hey, I’m Talen Serrao

I’m a Cybersecurity and Ethical Hacking graduate from Coventry University 🇬🇧 (First Class Honours), passionate about breaking and securing systems. Whether it’s exploiting a buffer overflow or building a secure communication protocol, I love exploring how things work — and how to make them safer.

🧠 What I Do

  • 🔍 Penetration Testing & Reverse Engineering
  • 🛡️ Network Security (ARP spoofing, DNS spoofing, Wi-Fi DoS attack mitigation)
  • 🧰 Tools: Metasploit, Wireshark, Burp Suite, Ghidra, Cutter, Scapy
  • 🧠 AI Integration in Security: Neural Networks with PyTorch for attack detection
  • 🔧 Secure software development using Python, Bash, C/C++, and JavaScript

📁 Projects

  • Wi-Fi DoS Mitigation Tool – Dissertation project using Scapy + AI detection with PyTorch
  • Realtek Driver Updater – Secure GUI-based tool for scanning and updating drivers
  • ROP & Buffer Overflow Exploits – Hands-on exploit development with GDB and pwntools
  • Secure Contract Exchange Protocol – AES-GCM-based symmetric cryptographic system

🌐 Online Presence

  • 💼 LinkedIn
  • 🛠️ GitHub – Explore my projects
  • 📫 Email: talenneil@hotmail.com

“Security isn’t just a field — it’s a mindset.”

item.title: Welcome to My Cybersecurity Blog
item.description:
👋 Hello and Welcome!

I’m Talen Neil Serrao, a graduate in Cybersecurity and Ethical Hacking from Coventry University 🇬🇧 — awarded First Class Honours. This blog is where I share my journey, experiments, and insights in the world of cybersecurity.

🧠 What You’ll Find Here

  • 🔍 Writeups of penetration testing labs and challenges (e.g. TryHackMe, HackTheBox)
  • 🛠️ Projects I’ve built — from reverse engineering tools to AI-enhanced detection systems
  • 🧬 Deep dives into buffer overflows, ROP chains, DoS attacks, and secure protocols
  • 🔐 Insights on cryptography, exploit development, and ethical hacking techniques

🧰 Tech I Use

  • Languages: Python, Bash, C, C++, JavaScript
  • Tools: Ghidra, Metasploit, Cutter, Wireshark, Burp Suite, Scapy, Pwntools
  • AI/ML: Neural networks with PyTorch for attack classification
  • Protocols: TCP/IP, DNS, HTTPS, Wi-Fi, and encrypted comms using AES-GCM

🚀 Why I Built This Site

To document and reflect on my learning, give back to the community, and stay sharp by sharing knowledge publicly. Cybersecurity is a fast-evolving field, and I believe in learning by doing — and teaching.
